New Records: San Diego Padres hit a total of six home runs, the most allowed by the Los Angeles Dodgers in a playoff game
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. hit a solo home run in the first inning
David Peralta hit a two-run home run in the second inning
Jurickson Profar robbed Mookie Betts with a game-saving catch
San Diego Padres' defense turned critical double plays and made web gems
Manny Machado and Jack Flaherty exchanged heated words during the game
Fans threw objects onto the field during the seventh inning, causing a delay
Los Angeles Dodgers scored only two runs in the game
Pre-Game Insights: San Diego Padres aimed to recapture their identity from Game 1
Yu Darvish pitched effectively against the Dodgers
The rivalry between the two teams was highlighted ahead of the game
Post-Match Reflections: Los Angeles Dodgers' Max Muncy commented on the team's poor performance
The series now shifts to San Diego for Game 3
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was part of a playoff trilogy between the two teams
San Diego Padres' performance was crucial to even the NLDS
